meanings.definition: A highway that encircles an urban area.
meanings.sent1: The beltways around the city make it easier to travel from one side to the other.
meanings.sent2: We took the beltways to avoid the heavy traffic in the city center.
meanings.sent3: The beltways decided to throw a party for all the other roads.
meanings.sent4: The beltways of the city are like giant loops wrapping around buildings and neighborhoods.
meanings.sent5: I'll never forget the view of the city skyline from the beltways at night.

meanings.sent1: The hikers followed the beltways through the forest, enjoying the scenic views.
meanings.sent2: The children played tag, running along the beltways of the playground.
meanings.sent3: The beltways in the maze led the participants in circles, confusing them.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts traveled in beltways, always coming back to the same starting point.
meanings.sent5: The beltways of the racetrack twisted and turned, challenging the drivers.

meanings.definition: A road or highway that forms a loop around a city.
meanings.sent1: The beltways were designed to ease congestion in the city center.
meanings.sent2: Drivers often use the beltways to bypass heavy traffic during rush hour.
meanings.sent3: The beltways threw a surprise parade for the main streets in the city.
meanings.sent4: The beltways encircled the city like a protective barrier against chaos.
meanings.sent5: The beltways offered a scenic drive with beautiful views of the city skyline.
